meanings.definition: Affected with or relating to chlorosis.
meanings.sent1: The chlorotic leaves lacked their usual green color.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient as chlorotic due to the pale complexion.
meanings.sent3: The chlorotic plants looked like they had been painted with a pastel brush.
meanings.sent4: Her face turned chlorotic under the fluorescent lights of the office.
meanings.sent5: The chlorotic hue of the sky during the storm made it seem eerie and otherworldly.

meanings.sent1: The chlorotic flowers wilted in the heat of the sun.
meanings.sent2: The farmer recognized the chlorotic patches on the crop leaves.
meanings.sent3: The chlorotic cat meowed weakly, seeking attention.
meanings.sent4: Her chlorotic complexion mirrored her inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The chlorotic glow of the fireflies lit up the night sky like tiny lanterns.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a pale green or yellow color.
meanings.sent1: The chlorotic sky at dawn hinted at the upcoming rain.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed blue and yellow to create a chlorotic shade.
meanings.sent3: The chlorotic walls of the old house reminded him of a faded memory.
meanings.sent4: Her chlorotic dress stood out among the vibrant crowd.
meanings.sent5: The chlorotic glow of the fireflies lit up the night sky like tiny lanterns.
